alert.note: Alert for Sumter (Alabama) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Warning issued January 25 at 3:15PM CST until January 29 at 7:42PM CST by NWS Birmingham
info.description: ...The Flood Warning is extended for the following rivers in Alabama... Sucarnoochee River At Livingston affecting Sumter County. .The Sucarnoochee River at Livingston is forecast to go above flood stage tomorrow night. A flood warning remains in effect. The next statement will be issued by Friday morning.Friday morning at 615 AM CST. && ...FLOOD WARNING NOW IN EFFECT FROM LATE FRIDAY NIGHT TO MONDAY EVENING... * WHAT...Minor flooding is forecast. * WHERE...Sucarnoochee River at Livingston. * WHEN...From late Friday night to Monday evening. * IMPACTS...At 18.0 feet, Flooding of farm lands around Livingston occurs. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 2:30 PM CST Thursday the stage was 12.2 feet. - Forecast...The river is expected to rise above flood stage early Saturday morning to a crest of 18.9 feet Saturday evening. It will then fall below flood stage Monday morning. - Flood stage is 18.0 feet. &&
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles.
